title: Improving Keen Visually (Brainstorm ideas)
content:
Imagine iDSoftware were remaking Keens 4,5,6. What kind of things would you like to see added or changed from the game (or levels) in order for it to be better (visually).

Use this thread to also talk about how levels could be modified in order for areas inside them to be more realisticlly meaningfull.

e.g. Theres a corridor with no significance, its there because it just is. What could this 'corridor' in the level be turned into to make it seem like its there for a reason?

Some suggestions could be for iDSoftware to:
* Add depth to the levels (i.e. a foreground, background)
* Rain
* Night levels
* Green floor in keen 5 should be metalic and have reflections
* Dirt floor tile in keen 4 should be grass
* Empty room could be turned into a surveillance room with monitors

Some ideas may be hard to explain and so a sketch like this may come in handy:

Windows in the walls of the pyramids with light seeping through

[img]http://img228.imageshack.us/img228/1034/minordetailow2.jpg[/img]

If you can think of a more appropriate texture for a certain wall please draw or explain what it should look like.

Discuss!

title: Re: Level Ideas
content:
If this is ID we're talking about, I'd say it'd be Keen GBC-3D

Wheras I like Keen pretty much as it is. I'd add teleporters, more items much, much more tiles, and possiblility of multiplayer.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

title: Re: Level Ideas
content: I'd rather they made new games instead of remaking the old ones, they're perfectly good already.  If they made new games though, I'd like to see the "next generation" engine look good, but still be very keenish.  Once upon a time this would've been simple - 256 colours - but now it would be tricky to make it look modern but still retain the keeny feel.

title: Re: Level Ideas
content:
I agree i'd also rather to see a new keen then a remake, but lets just focus on this [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

As for LL's comments, i think a teleporter is a very good idea, although we kind of already have that only in the shape of a door [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

As for the 'new tiles' can you be more specific? What kind of tiles?

title: Re: Level Ideas
content:
Free-form terrain would be neat. Kind of like Lightweight Ninja (which isn't tile based at all, as I understand it), for example, but Keenish. More detail overall would be fun to see. Also vector graphics would be great, since they could be scaled. Keens cartoonish style would mesh well with them.

EDIT: I like your mockup, by the way. It's cool to not only imagine updates but to see them as well.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

content: I'd like it like the game I'm playing now, Duke Nukem: Manhattan Project. The game would be completely 3D with kinky graphics, effects and stuff, but the movement would take place only in 2 axis, like in good old sidescrollers, therefore keeping the Keenishness.

title: Re: hehe

Well, some areas that are darker, the scrolling edges like in RKP3, some lighting effects like Alex has shown, scrolling backgrounds, etc.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Improving Keen Visually (Brainstorm ideas)
content:
Well, just small things:

3D levels like DNMP as has been mentioned, leaving the 2D gameplay, although of course also adding the going around corners bit used in DNMP.

Weather effects would be nice, rain and snow in the jungle and icy levels respectively, also the overall lighting could help set the mood, as well add added torches, lamps, etc., with coloured light.

Metal should reflect a bit, yup, and when running in the dirt you should leave footprints.
You should maybe even leave some dirt on the clean floor until it's all worn off as well.

The whole world should be influenced by your presence actually; plants could bend aside a bit when you're walking through them, things with eyes in the background (happens in some levels) should follow you around, small things like that.
All in all there shouldn't be too much gameplay changes, as the game wasn't/isn't popular for no reason.
More interactivity is usually nice, although having it just to have it is just dumb.
Puzzles where you can carry and throw things in the right place, somewhat Zelda-style would work in my opinion.
Of course the game should keep the cartoon look, and improve on it, using cell-shading for all the 3D stuff.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Improving Keen Visually (Brainstorm ideas)
content: Very important thing would be adding some interesting puzzles as mentioned and also lengthening the games a bit, they were far too short. Larger and more complex levels would do it. Maybe some interactivity with NPCs would be good, like dialogues.

title: cool stuff
content:
Taking certain elements of the level into the third dimension would be fantastic, if we're following the cel-shaded idea. Look at levels in Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards, or Crash Bandicoot 3: Warped for instance... they are essentially 2d games, done with 3d graphics. I would ADORE a Keengame done in this manner, even if it was a straight re-make/re-realization of Keen4, which is my least-favorite Keen.

Ultimately, though, if you're going to up the graphics you're going to have to up the animation, also. Games that look glorious but animate like crap are really loathesome in my eyes.

title: Re: Improving Keen Visually (Brainstorm ideas)
content:
Yes, puzzles would be great. As a fan of the Myst series, I like to have my brain melted regularly.

I know we're talking 2d but I would love to play 3d keen. Rayman II and Mario 64 showed me how much fun 3d platformers can be. A smart camera would be nice though.

I don't suppose id would appreciate a modern looking 3d fangame anyway.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: Improving Keen Visually (Brainstorm ideas)
content:
Graphics:
-Scrolling backgrounds (like the kind that move on thier own, and the kind that move at a speed depending on thier distance from keen.)
-Definately improve Keen 1-3, make them more like 4-6
-Keen 1 ground needs to be rockier
-More ground tiles (although keen 5-6 seem good, 4 is ok)

Gameplay ideas:
-More types of items
-More minigames (i remember somewhere saying that keen was gonna add more games than just paddle war)
-People to talk to?
-More integrated storylines, rather than "this is your story, go to every level now" (idk, this might make it too unkeenish.)
-Maybe some more moves for keen to do besides jumping, pogoing, and shooting. (though it might ruin the game)
-Bosses, minibosses?
-More levels!!!
-adding weather to the game (could be random, or just in certain levels.)

Idk, nothing too specific, but it'll help the brainstorming process a little.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Improving Keen Visually (Brainstorm ideas)
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]* Green floor in keen 5 should be metalic and have reflections[hr][/quote]

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v177/memsys/keentextest.jpg[/img]

[url=http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v177/memsys/keentextest-l.jpg]like this ? [large][/url]
[url=http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v177/memsys/keentextest-xl.jpg]
like this ? [extra-large][/url]

[url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]

Sorta... but really, rather than flat-texturing the floor like that, I'd make those ruts along the side actual indentions into the floor. I always thought they were conduits through which liquid might flow, rather than simple stripes on the sides. That's really the best way we could update the series visually--more detail in the scenery.

title: Re: haha
content: why do all your floors look transparent rather than reflective...

title: Re: haha
content: what do you mean with that ?[url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]

If you look at the floor in the right way, it looks as if you're looking down upon a pool of liquid, with a rectangular bottom. It's difficult to tell that the floor is 'reflective' without an entity of some sort standing atop it. The reflection is too perfect, so it looks more like you're looking through a translucent object.

Try making it more pseudo-metallic, like Metal Mario was on the N64, or the way the Metal Box powerup works in SSB:M.

I like your half-circle ruts. They're awesome.

title: perhaps new exe?
content:
What if someone made a new exe to run keen with direct3D and openGL like other people did to doom, quake and wolfinstein 3D so it can run on newer computers and possibly make new 3D models.
I've seen what they did to doom with the doomsday engine, everything looks cooler with openGL and new things could be added to it with pk3 files or something so new 3D models, new lighting, new glowing textures and more can be added.
Maybe even add different music to different keen games and adding new music to keen.
Don't forget winquake, because someone made that I can run quake on windows XP.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

title: Re: perhaps new exe?
content:
If and when the source code is released, expect just that. Although there are a couple of ports in progress based on reverse-engineering the EXEs, but they're likely to take a while.

Anyone have a link to that Keen4 remake that seemed to be coming along quite well, but isn't quite playable yet?

There's a fully-functional Keen1-3 clone. IIRK it's called CloneKeen. There are many discrepencies in the controls and physics and such, but it's at least completely playable and has some support for mods (I know it works with XkyKeen1 at least).
